task_name: Install and Configure IDE Tool for Development Team
context: to set up development environment for team members during onboarding or tool migration
description: Complete installation and configuration of IDE tools (Antigravity IDE or Cursor) for team members. Includes downloading software, installing on user's machine, configuring editor settings, setting up integrations with version control and AI assistants, and verifying functionality through test tasks. Essential for onboarding new developers and standardizing development environments across teams.
estimated_duration: 2 hours (30 min install + 1 hour config + 30 min testing)
dependencies: AI assistant API keys (Claude, Gemini, etc.)
tools_required: TOL-003 (Gemini 3 Pro) for AI coding assistance
success_criteria: IDE successfully installed and launches without errors
AI coding assistant connected and functional (autocomplete working)
Version control integration configured (can clone, commit, push)
Editor settings match team standards (formatting, linting)
User can successfully complete a test coding task

steps.name: Download and install IDE software
outputs: IDE application installed on user machine

steps.name: Configure basic editor settings
outputs: Tab size, line endings, formatting rules configured

steps.name: Set up AI coding assistant integration
Install required extensions and plugins
outputs: Productivity extensions added per team standards

steps.name: Set up workspace and project templates
Test IDE functionality with sample task
outputs: Sample code file created and edited

checklist.item: IDE installed and launches without errors
Required extensions installed per team standards
User trained on basic shortcuts and features

roi_metrics.time_savings: Saves 4-6 hours of trial-and-error setup for new developers
roi_metrics.quality_improvement: Ensures consistent coding standards across team with proper linting/formatting
roi_metrics.onboarding_efficiency: Reduces onboarding time by 1-2 days with standardized environment
